content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. It takes a Markdown document `md` as input and returns a String.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Define regex patterns to identify Julia code blocks
    julia_start = r"^(\s*)#\+.*\n"
    julia_end = r"^(\s*)\*.*"

    # Split the input string into lines
    lines = split(md, "\n")

    # Initialize an empty vector to store extracted Julia code blocks
    code_blocks = Vector{String}()

    # Iterate through each line of the input string
    for (i, line) in enumerate(lines)
        # Check if the current line matches the start pattern of a Julia code block
        if match(julia_start, line) !== nothing
            # Get the starting index of the Julia code block and add one to it
            start_index = match(julia_start, line).matchbegin + 1

            # Extract the Julia code block starting from the starting index until the end of the input string
            extracted_code_block = extract!(md, i+1, start_index)

            # Append the extracted Julia code block to the vector
            push!(code_blocks, extracted_code_block)
        end
    end

    # Join all the code blocks together with a newline and return the result as a String
    return join(code_blocks, "\n")
end
```

You can use this function to extract Julia code blocks from a Markdown document and return them as a single string.
